headline: Federal Reserve Cuts Interest Rates by 50 Basis Points Amid Economic Concerns
content: The Federal Reserve announced an unexpected 50 basis point rate cut, bringing the federal funds rate to 3.75%. Chair Powell cited weakening labor market indicators and declining inflation. Stock markets rallied sharply following the announcement.

headline: Amazon Announces Plans to Build 50 New Fulfillment Centers Worldwide
content: Amazon revealed a $25 billion investment plan to construct 50 new fulfillment centers across North America, Europe, and Asia. The expansion will create approximately 150,000 new jobs over the next three years. The move aims to reduce delivery times to under 12 hours for most customers.

headline: Boeing and Airbus Report Record Aircraft Orders at Dubai Airshow
content: Boeing and Airbus collectively secured over $180 billion in new aircraft orders at the Dubai Airshow. Emirates led purchases with 100 new widebody aircraft valued at $52 billion. The orders signal strong recovery in the global aviation industry post-pandemic.

headline: JPMorgan Chase Acquires Regional Bank Chain in $8.5 Billion Deal
content: JPMorgan Chase announced the acquisition of Western Alliance Bank, adding 400 branches across the Mountain West region. The deal represents the largest bank acquisition since the 2008 financial crisis. Regulators are expected to approve the merger by Q3 2026.

headline: Global Oil Prices Surge Past $100 After OPEC Announces Production Cuts
content: Crude oil prices jumped to $105 per barrel following OPEC's surprise announcement of 2 million barrel daily production cuts. The decision comes amid tensions in the Middle East and declining global inventories. Energy analysts warn of potential gasoline price increases of 20-30 cents per gallon.
